segments.text: I see the woman, so absorbed in her task, her face a mask of concentration.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on that dish, and yet the world is unraveling around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the sink, and I can hardly believe she doesn’t notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she be so unaware? It’s almost infuriating to watch her oblivion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The chaos that is brewing behind her – it’s like a scene from a comedy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is trying to grab cookies while precariously perched on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can feel my heart race as I imagine the consequences of a fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the girl stands there, innocent and hopeful, just waiting for her treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It strikes me how sweet yet reckless their little scheme is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could gently nudge her to look, just to make her aware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I’m just a bystander, left helpless while they play with fate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The beauty outside feels like a cruel contrast to this brewing disaster inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And I can’t shake the thought that these moments, they can change so quickly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can only watch as the children’s laughter fills the air, unaware of the threat that looms.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This may be a moment of joy, but it feels fragile, like glass about to shatter.
segments.speaker: PAR
